title: Greetings Section
historical_context: This article is part of the early hacking culture, showcasing the camaraderie and community among hackers and virus creators during the late 90s.
target_audience: Hackers, virus creators, and those interested in hacker culture.
short_summary: The article features a collection of greetings from various contributors to the zine, reflecting the personal connections and community spirit within the hacking scene.
summary:
In this light-hearted piece, various contributors share their greetings and well-wishes to friends and fellow hackers in the community. The greetings range from personal anecdotes to humorous remarks, showcasing the relationships and camaraderie that define the hacker culture. Each contributor expresses their appreciation for their peers, highlighting the importance of friendship and collaboration in the hacking scene. The tone is informal and playful, inviting readers to feel a sense of belonging within this unique subculture.

The article serves as a snapshot of the social dynamics among hackers during the late 90s, illustrating how personal connections often transcend the technical aspects of hacking. It emphasizes the idea that hacking is not just about technical prowess but also about the community that supports and encourages individuals in their pursuits. This piece, while not technically focused, provides valuable insight into the culture and ethos of the time, making it a relevant read for those interested in the history of hacking and its communities.
